dataIdInfo.idAbs: This utility tool divides a polygon (such as a channel buffer) using the segments from a flow or center line. This is useful for confinement calculations.

tool.name: DividePolygonBySegmentsTool

param.name: InputFCCenterline
param.dialogReference:
Centerline or stream network of the polygon that will be used to divide the polygon into segments.

Polygon will be divided according to the features in this network.

param.name: InputFCPolygon
param.dialogReference: Polygon that will be segmented by the centerline.

param.name: fcSegmentedPolygons
param.dialogReference: Name and location of the output polygon feature class

param.name: scratchWorkspace
param.dialogReference: Create a file GDB to store temporary processing files

param.name: DoublePointDensity
param.dialogReference: Density of Thiessen polygon seed points to use within the Junction Buffer. Higher density should result in a finer resolution of the segmented edges in the output polygon

param.name: dblJunctionBuffer
param.dialogReference: Buffer to limit the generation of Thiessen seed points around tributary junctions only. This is to reduce the amount of processing time.

tool.summary: This utility tool divides a polygon (such as a channel buffer) using the segments from a flow or center line. This is useful for confinement calculations.
